translated: the many buddhas will prophesy that such individuals will attain unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: rab gnas / gang la la zhig gis gzungs 'di yongs su 'dzin par byed na /
analyzed: rab gnas / gang la la zhig gis gzungs 'di yongs su 'dzin par byed na /
translated: “Subhūti, anyone who upholds this dhāraṇī

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gos dang / zas dang / nor dang / rin po che dang / mang du thos pa dang / shes rab rno ba dang / nad med cing tshe ring ba dang / bsod nams mang po thob par 'gyur bas ji ltar mos pa rnams yid bzhin du mi 'grub pa gang yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gos dang / zas dang / nor dang / rin po che dang / mang du thos pa dang / shes rab rno ba dang / nad med cing tshe ring ba dang / bsod nams mang po thob par 'gyur bas ji ltar mos pa rnams yid bzhin du mi 'grub pa gang yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: As they wish, they will obtain clothing, food, wealth, jewels, extensive learning, sharp wisdom, good health, long life, and much merit. There will be nothing that they wish for that will not be fulfilled.

original: rab gnas / gzungs 'di yongs su 'dzin par byed pa gang yin pa de ni bla na med pa'i byang chub ma thob kyi bar du rtag par @92a *//
analyzed: rab gnas / gzungs 'di yongs su 'dzin par byed pa gang yin pa de ni bla na med pa'i byang chub ma thob kyi bar du rtag par @92a *//
translated: “Subhūti, those who uphold this dhāraṇī will always be protected by the buddhas until they attain unsurpassed awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gser gyi grong khyer kyi ri dang / byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal dang / byang chub sems dpa' ma h'a bing ga la la sogs pa dang lhan cig gnas par 'gyur bas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su srung zhing yongs su bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gser gyi grong khyer kyi ri dang / byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal dang / byang chub sems dpa' ma h'a bing ga la la sogs pa dang lhan cig gnas par 'gyur bas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su srung zhing yongs su bsrung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will dwell together with the bodhisattvas Suvarṇanagarīśikharadhara, Maitreya, Sāgara, Avalokiteśvara, Mañjuśrī, Mahāviṃkaroca, and so forth. He will be protected and guarded by the bodhisattvas.

original: rab gnas / 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab gnas / 'di ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it should be known as follows:

original: sngags 'di yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshe cho ga 'di ltar bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshe cho ga 'di ltar bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: When upholding this mantra, one should accomplish it with this ritual.

original: sngags lan khri rtsa brgyad tshang bar bzlas te bsnyen pa'i cho ga bya'o //
analyzed: sngags lan khri rtsa brgyad tshang bar bzlas te bsnyen pa'i cho ga bya'o //
translated: One should complete the recitation of this mantra one hundred thousand and eight times, and perform the approach ritual.

original: de nas khang pa dben pa'i nang du dkyil 'khor brgyan nas zla ba yar gyi ngo'i tshes gcig la khrus yongs su dag par byas te gos sar pa bgos nas spos bsregs me tog gtor te bza' ba dang / btung ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mchod pa byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi nang du zhugs te thog ma kho nar sngar gong du bstan pa'i sangs rgyas dang /
analyzed: de nas khang pa dben pa'i nang du dkyil 'khor brgyan nas zla ba yar gyi ngo'i tshes gcig la khrus yongs su dag par byas te gos sar pa bgos nas spos bsregs me tog gtor te bza' ba dang / btung ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mchod pa byas nas dkyil 'khor gyi nang du zhugs te thog ma kho nar sngar gong du bstan pa'i sangs rgyas dang /
translated: Then, in an isolated place, having adorned the maṇḍala, having performed the completely pure ablution on the first day of the waxing moon, having put on new clothes, having burned incense, having scattered flowers, having made offerings with various foods and drinks, having entered inside the maṇḍala, first, as previously explained, one should make offerings to the buddhas, bodhisattvas, pratyekabuddhas, śrāvakas, and so on, and having made offerings to the maṇḍala master, one should request the empowerment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan nas brjod de sems rtse gcig tu gus pas phyag byas nas sngar byas pa'i sdig pa rnams bshags te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga  la btsugs nas sngar bstan pa'i gzungs sngags lan stong rtsa brgyad @92b bzlas te lus drang🔽por bsrang nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mtshan nas brjod de sems rtse gcig tu gus pas phyag byas nas sngar byas pa'i sdig pa rnams bshags te pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga  la btsugs nas sngar bstan pa'i gzungs sngags lan stong rtsa brgyad @92b bzlas te lus drang por bsrang nas /
translated: Then, in a secluded place, having adorned the maṇḍala, on the first day of the waxing moon, having performed a thorough purification, having put on new clothes, having burned incense, having scattered flowers, having made offerings of various kinds of food and drink, having entered into the maṇḍala, first of all, having recited the names of the buddhas and bodhisattvas taught above, having made obeisance with a one-pointed, respectful mind, having confessed the misdeeds done previously, having knelt on the right knee, having recited the dhāraṇī mantra taught above eight thousand times, having straightened the body,

original: yid la bya zhing smon lam rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la bya zhing smon lam rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: one should focus the mind and recollect the prayers.

original: nyi ma shar ba dang dkyil 'khor gyi nang du zas gtsang ma gcig tu bza' bar bya zhing nyin gcig la zas gcig bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma shar ba dang dkyil 'khor gyi nang du zas gtsang ma gcig tu bza' bar bya zhing nyin gcig la zas gcig bza' bar bya'o //
translated: When the sun rises, one should eat pure food within the maṇḍala and eat only one meal a day.

original: zhag bco lnga tshang nas dkyil 'khor nas 'byung bar byed na gang zag de bsod  nams dang / gzi byin mthu stobs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan par 'gyur bas ci dang / ci smon pa mi 'grub pa gang yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag bco lnga tshang nas dkyil 'khor nas 'byung bar byed na gang zag de bsod  nams dang / gzi byin mthu stobs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan par 'gyur bas ci dang / ci smon pa mi 'grub pa gang yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When fifteen days have passed, if one emerges from the maṇḍala, that person will possess inconceivable merit, splendor, and power. There will be nothing that is not accomplished, whatever one wishes for.

original: gal te yid bzhin du 'grub par ma gyur na'ang dkyil 'khor gyi nang du 'jug par bya zhing bsam pa bzhin du 'grub nas kyang rtag par yid la bya zhing brjed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yid bzhin du 'grub par ma gyur na'ang dkyil 'khor gyi nang du 'jug par bya zhing bsam pa bzhin du 'grub nas kyang rtag par yid la bya zhing brjed par mi bya'o //
translated: If it is not accomplished as wished, one should enter the maṇḍala. Once it is accomplished as wished, one should always keep it in mind and not forget it.

original: gser 'od dam pa mchog tu rnam par rgyal ba mdo sde'i rgyal po las /
analyzed: gser 'od dam pa mchog tu rnam par rgyal ba mdo sde'i rgyal po las /
translated: From the King of Glorious Sutras, the Sublime Golden Light,

original: gser rgyal gyi gzungs kyi le'u ste brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: gser rgyal gyi gzungs kyi le'u ste brgyad pa'o ////
translated: the chapter on the Dhāraṇī of Suvarṇa is the eighth.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gzungs sngags de bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gzungs sngags de bka' stsal nas /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, having spoken that dhāraṇī,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / lha dang / mi dang / 'khor mang po rnams la phan gdags shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / lha dang / mi dang / 'khor mang po rnams la phan gdags shing /
translated: In order to benefit the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, gods, humans, and the great assembly,

original: de kho na nyid kyi don dam pa shin tu zab pa khong du chud par mdzad par bzhad pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yang bstan pa'i ched du tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don dam pa shin tu zab pa khong du chud par mdzad par bzhad pa'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yang bstan pa'i ched du tshigs su bcad de bka' stsal pa /
translated: and to cause them to understand the extremely profound meaning of suchness, in order to teach the nature of emptiness, he spoke in verse, saying:

original: nga yis mdo sde zab mo gzhan dag las //
analyzed: nga yis mdo sde zab mo gzhan dag las //
translated: In other profound sūtras,

original: yang dag stong pa nyid dag chos bshad pa //
analyzed: yang dag stong pa nyid dag chos bshad pa //
translated: I have explained the Dharma of true emptiness.

original: deng 'dir mdo sde'i rgyal po @93a *//
analyzed: deng 'dir mdo sde'i rgyal po @93a *//
translated: Here, in this king of sūtras,

original: 'di las kyang //
analyzed: 'di las kyang //
translated: I will also explain

original: stong nyid bsam gyis mi khyab mdo tsam bshad //
analyzed: stong nyid bsam gyis mi khyab mdo tsam bshad //
translated: A mere summary of the inconceivable emptiness.

original: zab mo'i chos ni rgya chen mang po la //
analyzed: zab mo'i chos ni rgya chen mang po la //
translated: In the many vast and profound dharmas,

original: sems can shes med rig par mi nus pas /
analyzed: sems can shes med rig par mi nus pas /
translated: Sentient beings, lacking understanding, are unable to comprehend.

original: de'i phyir ngas 'dir bzlas te bstan pas na //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngas 'dir bzlas te bstan pas na //
translated: Therefore, by my repeating and teaching here,

original: stong pa'i chos ni rab tu rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'i chos ni rab tu rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: They will thoroughly understand the Dharma of emptiness.

original: thugs rje chen pos sems can brtse ba'i phyir //
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos sems can brtse ba'i phyir //
translated: Out of great compassion, loving sentient beings,

original: shin tu thabs mkhas rgyu rkyen mchog /
analyzed: shin tu thabs mkhas rgyu rkyen mchog /
translated: With the most skillful causes and conditions,

original: dag gis // ngas  deng 'khor 'dus chen po 'di nang du //
analyzed: dag gis // ngas  deng 'khor 'dus chen po 'di nang du //
translated: I will now, within this great assembly,

original: bstan pas de dag stong don gsal rtogs 'gyur //
analyzed: bstan pas de dag stong don gsal rtogs 'gyur //
translated: Explain so that they may clearly understand the meaning of emptiness.

original: lus 'di grong stong 'dra bar shes byas te //
analyzed: lus 'di grong stong 'dra bar shes byas te //
translated: Know that this body is like an empty town,

original: rkun po drug gnas phan tshun yong mi shes //
analyzed: rkun po drug gnas phan tshun yong mi shes //
translated: With six thieves dwelling in it, not knowing each other.

original: yul drug rkun po tha dad dbang po gnas //
analyzed: yul drug rkun po tha dad dbang po gnas //
translated: The six sense objects are different thieves, the faculties are the abodes,

original: so sor phan tshun mi shes de bzhin no //
analyzed: so sor phan tshun mi shes de bzhin no //
translated: Each not knowing each other, it is the same.

original: mig gi dbang po rtag par gzugs la blta //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po rtag par gzugs la blta //
translated: The eye faculty always sees forms,

original: rna ba'i dbang po sgra nyan rgyun mi 'chad //🔽sna yi dbang pos rgyun tu dri yul snom //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po sgra nyan rgyun mi 'chad // sna yi dbang pos rgyun tu dri yul snom //
translated: The ear faculty listens to sounds without interruption,🔽The nose faculty always smells the sense object of smell,

original: lce yi dbang pos rtag par ro zhim myong //
analyzed: lce yi dbang pos rtag par ro zhim myong //
translated: The tongue faculty always tastes delicious flavors,

original: lus kyi dbang pos yang 'jam reg bya len //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang pos yang 'jam reg bya len //
translated: The body faculty takes in soft and smooth textures,

original: yid kyi dbang pos chos rig skyo mi shes //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang pos chos rig skyo mi shes //
translated: The mind faculty knows phenomena and is never sated.

original: dbang po 'di drug dngos po'i rjes 'brang bas //
analyzed: dbang po 'di drug dngos po'i rjes 'brang bas //
translated: These six faculties follow after entities,

original: so so'i rang yul dag la rtog pa skyed //
analyzed: so so'i rang yul dag la rtog pa skyed //
translated: Each producing thoughts about their own objects.

original: rnam shes sgyu sprul 'dra bas yang dag min //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu sprul 'dra bas yang dag min //
translated: Consciousness is not real, like an illusory creation.

original: dbang po gnas nas mi dben 'dod pas tshol //
analyzed: dbang po gnas nas mi dben 'dod pas tshol //
translated: And, seeking what is not separate from the sense faculties,

original: dper na mi zhig grong stong rgyug pa ltar //
analyzed: dper na mi zhig grong stong rgyug pa ltar //
translated: It is like a man running through an empty town.

original: rnam shes drug po dbang gnas de bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam shes drug po dbang gnas de bzhin no //
translated: The six consciousnesses are like this, dwelling in the sense faculties.

original: sems ni kun tshol gnas kyi rjes su 'jug /
analyzed: sems ni kun tshol gnas kyi rjes su 'jug /
translated: The mind seeks everywhere and follows the objects.

original: dbang rten @93b yul dmigs dngos pos rnam rig pas //
analyzed: dbang rten @93b yul dmigs dngos pos rnam rig pas //
translated: Because of the support of the sense faculties, the objects, and the entities, there is consciousness.

original: rtag par gzugs sgra dri ro reg la sred //
analyzed: rtag par gzugs sgra dri ro reg la sred //
translated: Constantly craving forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures,

original: chos la spyod pas skad cig tsam mi gnas //
analyzed: chos la spyod pas skad cig tsam mi gnas //
translated: The one who practices the Dharma does not remain even for a moment.

original: rkyen ni ji bzhin dbang drug kun rgyug pas //
analyzed: rkyen ni ji bzhin dbang drug kun rgyug pas //
translated: The six sense faculties always run according to conditions,

original: mkha' la bya 'phur thogs pa med pa 'dra //
analyzed: mkha' la bya 'phur thogs pa med pa 'dra //
translated: Like a bird flying in the sky without obstruction.

original: dbang po rten byed de la ltos nas ni //
analyzed: dbang po rten byed de la ltos nas ni //
translated: In dependence on the support of the sense faculties,

original: phyi rol yul ni rnam par rig par nus //
analyzed: phyi rol yul ni rnam par rig par nus //
translated: The external objects are able to be cognized.

original: lus 'di shes med byed pa po yang med //
analyzed: lus 'di shes med byed pa po yang med //
translated: This body is without consciousness and without an agent.

original: rang bzhin mi brtan rkyen la ltos nas grub //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi brtan rkyen la ltos nas grub //
translated: Unstable by nature, it is established in dependence on conditions.

original: yang dag ma yin rnam rtog las skyes pas //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin rnam rtog las skyes pas //
translated: Because it arises from false imagination,

original: 'khrul 'khor bzhin du las kyi dbang gis 'jug /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor bzhin du las kyi dbang gis 'jug /
translated: It functions by the power of karma, like a machine.

original: sa chu me rlung lhan cig lus bsgrubs pas //
analyzed: sa chu me rlung lhan cig lus bsgrubs pas //
translated: The body is accomplished through the combination of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: rgyu rkyen ji bzhin tha dad 'bras bu 'thob //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen ji bzhin tha dad 'bras bu 'thob //
translated: Each receives its own particular result.

original: lhan cig gnas kyang phan tshun gnod byed pas //
analyzed: lhan cig gnas kyang phan tshun gnod byed pas //
translated: Even though they live together, they harm each other.

original: sbrul gdug bzhi po gzeb gcig gnas pa 'dra //
analyzed: sbrul gdug bzhi po gzeb gcig gnas pa 'dra //
translated: They are like four poisonous snakes living in the same cage.

original: 'byung chen sbrul bzhi rang bzhin tha dad pas //
analyzed: 'byung chen sbrul bzhi rang bzhin tha dad pas //
translated: The four great elements are like four poisonous snakes.

original: lhan cig gnas kyang mtho dang dma' ba yod //
analyzed: lhan cig gnas kyang mtho dang dma' ba yod //
translated: Even though they live together, they are of different natures.

original: steng 'og 'gro zhing lus ni kun tu khyab //
analyzed: steng 'og 'gro zhing lus ni kun tu khyab //
translated: One goes up, one goes down, and they pervade the body.

original: de dag mthar ni zad pa'i chos su 'gro /
analyzed: de dag mthar ni zad pa'i chos su 'gro /
translated: In the end, they are subject to exhaustion.

original: sbrul gdug rnam pa bzhi po de dag las //
analyzed: sbrul gdug rnam pa bzhi po de dag las //
translated: Of these four poisonous snakes,

original: sa chu sbrul gnyis phan cher thur du 'bying //
analyzed: sa chu sbrul gnyis phan cher thur du 'bying //
translated: The two snakes of earth and water are heavy and sink down.

original: me rlung sbrul gnyis rang bzhin yang bas na //
analyzed: me rlung sbrul gnyis rang bzhin yang bas na //
translated: The two snakes of fire and wind are light by nature.

original: mi mthun 'di dbang nad mang skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi mthun 'di dbang nad mang skye bar 'gyur //
translated: Because of their incompatibility, many illnesses arise.

original: sems dang rnam shes lus 'di gnas nas ni //
analyzed: sems dang rnam shes lus 'di gnas nas ni //
translated: The mind and consciousness leave this body

original: dge sdig las ni sna tshogs byed pas na //
analyzed: dge sdig las ni sna tshogs byed pas na //
translated: And create various virtuous and nonvirtuous karma.

original: lha mi ngan 'gro gsum du song nas ni //
analyzed: lha mi ngan 'gro gsum du song nas ni //
translated: Having gone to the three realms of gods, humans, and the lower realms,

original: lus stobs ji bzhin lus ni len par byed //
analyzed: lus stobs ji bzhin lus ni len par byed //
translated: They take on bodies according to their strength.

original: nad dang phrad nas lus @94a *//
analyzed: nad dang phrad nas lus @94a *//
translated: When they encounter illness, the body

original: ni shi ba'i 'og /
analyzed: ni shi ba'i 'og /
translated: Dies after death.

original: bshang gci mi gtsang thams cad kun tu snang //
analyzed: bshang gci mi gtsang thams cad kun tu snang //
translated: And all the filth of excrement and urine.

original: rul myags 'bus gces blta bar yong mi mos //
analyzed: rul myags 'bus gces blta bar yong mi mos //
translated: You will not want to look at the rotting, festering, worm-infested corpse.

original: dur khrod bor nas shing rul 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dur khrod bor nas shing rul 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: It will be discarded in the charnel ground, like a discarded log.

original: khyod kyis chos rnams de ltar blta bar byos //
analyzed: khyod kyis chos rnams de ltar blta bar byos //
translated: You should look at phenomena in this way.

original: ci phyir bdag dang sems can yod par 'dzin //
analyzed: ci phyir bdag dang sems can yod par 'dzin //
translated: Why do you cling to the existence of a self and sentient beings?

original: chos rnams thams cad 'dzad pas mi rtag ste //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad 'dzad pas mi rtag ste //
translated: All phenomena are impermanent, because they are subject to destruction.

original: thams cad ma rig rkyen gyi mthu las byung //
analyzed: thams cad ma rig rkyen gyi mthu las byung //
translated: They all arise through the power of conditions, which are themselves ignorant.

original: 'byung chen de dag yang dag min pas na //
analyzed: 'byung chen de dag yang dag min pas na //
translated: Since these great elements are not real,

original: yang dag yod min rang bzhin skye med pas //
analyzed: yang dag yod min rang bzhin skye med pas //
translated: They do not exist in reality, because they are not inherently produced.

original: de phyir 'byung chen ngo bo stong par bshad //
analyzed: de phyir 'byung chen ngo bo stong par bshad //
translated: Therefore, the essence of the great elements is explained to be empty.

original: 'di dag stong zhing yang dag min rig byos //
analyzed: 'di dag stong zhing yang dag min rig byos //
translated: You should understand that they are empty and unreal.

original: ma rig rang bzhin gzod ma nyid kyis med //
analyzed: ma rig rang bzhin gzod ma nyid kyis med //
translated: Ignorance is, by nature, primordially nonexistent.

original: rkyen mang mthu ltos tshogs las yod pa min //
analyzed: rkyen mang mthu ltos tshogs las yod pa min //
translated: It does not exist through the convergence of many conditions, which are themselves dependent.

original: dus rnams kun tu yang dag blos stong pas //
analyzed: dus rnams kun tu yang dag blos stong pas //
translated: The mind that is aware of reality is always empty.

original: de phyir nga yis ma rig yin par bshad //
analyzed: de phyir nga yis ma rig yin par bshad //
translated: Therefore, I have explained it to be ignorance.

original: 'du byed rnam shes rkyen byas ming gzugs yod //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam shes rkyen byas ming gzugs yod //
translated: Conditioned by consciousness and volitional action, name and form exist.

original: skye mched drug dang reg tshor rjes su skye //
analyzed: skye mched drug dang reg tshor rjes su skye //
translated: The six sense bases, contact, and feeling arise in sequence.

original: sred len srid skye rga shi bskyed pas na //
analyzed: sred len srid skye rga shi bskyed pas na //
translated: Craving, grasping, and becoming give rise to birth, aging, and death.

original: mya ngan smre sngags 'khrug pa rjes su 'brang //
analyzed: mya ngan smre sngags 'khrug pa rjes su 'brang //
translated: Sorrow, lamentation, suffering, and distress follow.

original: sdug bsngal sna tshogs las ngan rtag dkris gzir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs las ngan rtag dkris gzir //
translated: Various sufferings and negative actions constantly entangle and oppress.

original: 'khor bar 'khor ba dag la tshad dus med //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'khor ba dag la tshad dus med //
translated: In cyclic existence, there is no limit or time.

original: rang bzhin yod min ngo bo nyid stong yang //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod min ngo bo nyid stong yang //
translated: Although there is no inherent nature and emptiness of essence,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin rnam par rtog pa bskyed //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin rnam par rtog pa bskyed //
translated: Incorrect thoughts are produced.

original: nga yis nyon mongs thams cad rab spangs nas //
analyzed: nga yis nyon mongs thams cad rab spangs nas //
translated: I have completely abandoned all afflictions

original: rtag par yang dag ye shes mngon rgyu bas //
analyzed: rtag par yang dag ye shes mngon rgyu bas //
translated: And always manifest perfect wisdom.

original: lnga phung @94b khang khyim thams cad stong rtogs nas //
analyzed: lnga phung @94b khang khyim thams cad stong rtogs nas //
translated: Realizing that all five aggregates and houses are empty,

original: byang chub yang dag gnas ni btsal ba yin //
analyzed: byang chub yang dag gnas ni btsal ba yin //
translated: I sought the abode of perfect awakening.

original: nga yis bdud rtsi grong chen sgo phya  nas //
analyzed: nga yis bdud rtsi grong chen sgo phya  nas //
translated: I have opened the door to the city of deathlessness

original: gya nom bdud rtsi snod ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: gya nom bdud rtsi snod ni bstan pa yin //
translated: And revealed the vessel of excellent nectar.

original: yang dag bdud rtsi ro ni brnyes nas kyang //
analyzed: yang dag bdud rtsi ro ni brnyes nas kyang //
translated: Having attained the taste of perfect nectar,

original: rtag par bdud rtsi skye dgu sbyin pa btang //
analyzed: rtag par bdud rtsi skye dgu sbyin pa btang //
translated: And always gave the nectar of immortality to all beings.

original: ngas ni chos kyi rnga chen dam pa brdungs //🔽ngas ni chos kyi dung chen mchog kyang bus //🔽ngas ni chos kyi sgron chen rab kyang spar //
analyzed: ngas ni chos kyi rnga chen dam pa brdungs // ngas ni chos kyi dung chen mchog kyang bus // ngas ni chos kyi sgron chen rab kyang spar //
translated: I beat the great, holy drum of the Dharma.🔽I blew the supreme conch of the Dharma.🔽I lit the great lamp of the Dharma.

original: ngas ni chos kyis char chen dam pa phab //
analyzed: ngas ni chos kyis char chen dam pa phab //
translated: I brought down the great, holy rain of the Dharma.

original: nyon mongs dgra rnams rab tu pha ma byas te //
analyzed: nyon mongs dgra rnams rab tu pha ma byas te //
translated: I destroyed the enemies of the afflictions.

original: bla med chos kyi rgyal mtshan chen po bsgreng //
analyzed: bla med chos kyi rgyal mtshan chen po bsgreng //
translated: I raised the great victory banner of the unsurpassed Dharma.

original: 'khor ba'i mtsho las skye dgu rmongs pa bzlas //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mtsho las skye dgu rmongs pa bzlas //
translated: I rescued the confused beings from the ocean of saṃsāra.

original: nga yis ngan 'gro gsum gyi sgo yang bcad //
analyzed: nga yis ngan 'gro gsum gyi sgo yang bcad //
translated: I closed the doors to the three lower realms.

original: nyon mongs 'bar mes sems can rab bsregs te //
analyzed: nyon mongs 'bar mes sems can rab bsregs te //
translated: Beings were burned by the blazing fire of the afflictions.

original: mgon dang skyabs byed med pa dag la ni //
analyzed: mgon dang skyabs byed med pa dag la ni //
translated: They had no protector or refuge.

original: rab bsil bdud rtsis de dag tshim byas nas //
analyzed: rab bsil bdud rtsis de dag tshim byas nas //
translated: I satisfied them with the cool nectar

original: lus dang sems kyi gdung ba zhi bar byas //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi gdung ba zhi bar byas //
translated: And pacified the torments of their bodies and minds.

original: de nas ngas ni bskal pa tshad med snyed //
analyzed: de nas ngas ni bskal pa tshad med snyed //
translated: Then for countless eons,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gus mchod byas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gus mchod byas //
translated: I respectfully made offerings to the Tathāgatas.

original: tshul khrims rab bsrungs byang chub gzhol nas ni //
analyzed: tshul khrims rab bsrungs byang chub gzhol nas ni //
translated: And, having kept pure conduct and turned to enlightenment,

original: chos sku bde ba'i gnas ni btsal ba yin //
analyzed: chos sku bde ba'i gnas ni btsal ba yin //
translated: I sought the state of bliss, the body of truth.🔽I gave away my eyes, feet, hands, and ears,

original: gzhan la mig ngang rkang lag rna ba dang // bu dang chung ma bran btang phangs pa med //
analyzed: gzhan la mig ngang rkang lag rna ba dang // bu dang chung ma bran btang phangs pa med //
translated: My children, wife, and servants, without any regret.🔽I gave away all my wealth,

original: nor dang rin chen bdun gyi rgyan phreng dag /
analyzed: nor dang rin chen bdun gyi rgyan phreng dag /
translated: My jewels, and my garlands of precious stones,

original: slong ba dag la thams cad yongs su btang //
analyzed: slong ba dag la thams cad yongs su btang //
translated: To those who asked for them.

original: bzod sogs pha rol phyin pa kun bsgoms pas //
analyzed: bzod sogs pha rol phyin pa kun bsgoms pas //
translated: I cultivated patience and all the perfections,

original: sa bcu yongs rdzogs yang @95a *//
analyzed: sa bcu yongs rdzogs yang @95a *//
translated: And completed the ten stages,

original: dag mngon sangs rgyas //
analyzed: dag mngon sangs rgyas //
translated: And truly attained buddhahood.

original: de phyir nga ni thams cad mkhyen brjod kyang //
analyzed: de phyir nga ni thams cad mkhyen brjod kyang //
translated: Therefore, although I am called omniscient,

original: sems can gang yang gzhal bar nus pa med //🔽gal te stong gsum stong chen 'jig rten khams //
analyzed: sems can gang yang gzhal bar nus pa med // gal te stong gsum stong chen 'jig rten khams //
translated: No being can be found.🔽If all the things that grow on this great earth🔽In the billion worlds of the great trichiliocosm—🔽The forests, trees, rice, and sesame,

original: sa chen 'di las skyes pa'i dngos rnams dang // nags tshal ljon shing s'a lu til rnams dang // 'dam  la sogs yal ga ji snyed pa //
analyzed: sa chen 'di las skyes pa'i dngos rnams dang // nags tshal ljon shing s'a lu til rnams dang // 'dam  la sogs yal ga ji snyed pa //
translated: The branches, and so on, in the swamps—

original: 'di la sogs pa'i dngos po bcad btubs te //
analyzed: 'di la sogs pa'i dngos po bcad btubs te //
translated: Were all cut down,🔽And their stumps, branches, and leaves were counted one by one,

original: thams cad rdul phran phye mar byas pa dang // gang nas bsdus spungs tshad ni shes dka' dang // de bzhin nam mkha'i khams ni gang ba yi //
analyzed: thams cad rdul phran phye mar byas pa dang // gang nas bsdus spungs tshad ni shes dka' dang // de bzhin nam mkha'i khams ni gang ba yi //
translated: and it is difficult to know the measure of where they are gathered and piled up.

original: phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams dag ni thams cad na //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams dag ni thams cad na //
translated: In the same way, the realms in the ten directions are filled🔽with the dust of the earth of the trichiliocosm.

original: stong gsum stong chen 'jig rten ji snyed pa'i //
analyzed: stong gsum stong chen 'jig rten ji snyed pa'i //
translated: “The dust of the earth of the trichiliocosm

original: sa rnams rdul kyi phye mar byas gyur na //
analyzed: sa rnams rdul kyi phye mar byas gyur na //
translated: is ground into dust,

original: rdul 'di tshad ni bgrang bar mi nus pas //
analyzed: rdul 'di tshad ni bgrang bar mi nus pas //
translated: and it is impossible to know the measure of that dust.

original: sems can thams cad shes pa ci yod pa //
analyzed: sems can thams cad shes pa ci yod pa //
translated: “All the knowledge that all beings have

original: shes pa de kun mi gcig rab byin nas //
analyzed: shes pa de kun mi gcig rab byin nas //
translated: is given to a single being.

original: 'di ltar de yi shes pa tshad med pas //
analyzed: 'di ltar de yi shes pa tshad med pas //
translated: In that way, because his knowledge is immeasurable,

original: rdul phran de yi grangs ni shes rung yang //
analyzed: rdul phran de yi grangs ni shes rung yang //
translated: it is possible to know the number of those atoms.

original: bcom ldan thub pas skad cig gang mkhyen pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan thub pas skad cig gang mkhyen pa //
translated: “The moment that the Bhagavān, the Muni, knows

original: shes ldan de dag lhan cig gzhal bcug na //
analyzed: shes ldan de dag lhan cig gzhal bcug na //
translated: is placed together with the knowledge of those who know,

original: bskal pa bye ba mang po grangs snyed du //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba mang po grangs snyed du //
translated: even for many millions of eons,

original: cung zad tsam yang brtsi zhing shes mi nus //
analyzed: cung zad tsam yang brtsi zhing shes mi nus //
translated: it is not possible to know even a small part of it.”

original: de'i tshe 'khor mang po rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zab mo 'di lta bu bkas bshad pa thos nas sems can @95b tshad med pa snyed 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / phung po lnga po dag rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor mang po rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin zab mo 'di lta bu bkas bshad pa thos nas sems can @95b tshad med pa snyed 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / phung po lnga po dag rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa dang /
translated: At that time, the many beings in the assembly, having heard the Blessed One explain this profound nature of emptiness, realized that countless beings, the four great elements, and the five aggregates are empty by nature.

original: dbang po drug dang / yul drug po yang dag pa ma yin pas 'ching ba bskyed par mngon par rtogs par gyur nas 'khor ba yongs su spangs te nges par 'byung ba yang dag par sgrub par smon lam btab nas shin tu dang ba'i sems kyis rab tu dga' bar gyur pas ji
analyzed: dbang po drug dang / yul drug po yang dag pa ma yin pas 'ching ba bskyed par mngon par rtogs par gyur nas 'khor ba yongs su spangs te nges par 'byung ba yang dag par sgrub par smon lam btab nas shin tu dang ba'i sems kyis rab tu dga' bar gyur pas ji
translated: They realized that the six sense faculties and the six sense objects are created by the bonds of falsity, and they abandoned saṃsāra and made aspirations to accomplish true liberation. With a mind of utmost clarity, they became overjoyed.

original: skad bstan pa bzhin du gus pas spyod par gyur to //
analyzed: skad bstan pa bzhin du gus pas spyod par gyur to //
translated: They respectfully practiced in accordance with the teachings.

original: gser 'od dam pa mchog tu rnam par rgyal ba mdo sde'i rgyal po las /
analyzed: gser 'od dam pa mchog tu rnam par rgyal ba mdo sde'i rgyal po las /
translated: From the King of Glorious Sutras, the Sublime Golden Light, Most Victorious in the Three Worlds,

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i le'u ste dgu pa'o ////
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'i le'u ste dgu pa'o ////
translated: this is the ninth chapter, on the teaching of the nature of emptiness.

original: de nas lha'i bu mo yid bzhin rin chen 'od 'phro 'khor mang po'i nang du chos zab mo thos pas dga' mgu rangs par gyur nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te gus pas
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu mo yid bzhin rin chen 'od 'phro 'khor mang po'i nang du chos zab mo thos pas dga' mgu rangs par gyur nas stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te gus pas
translated: Then, the celestial maiden Wish-Fulfilling Precious Radiance, having heard the profound Dharma in the midst of the assembly, became joyful, delighted, and elated. She rose from her seat, draped her upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on her right knee.

original: thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: With palms joined, she respectfully addressed the Blessed One, saying:🔽Blessed One, please explain the Dharma of cultivating yoga in the profound principles.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don gyi tshul zab mo dag la rnal 'byor bsgoms pa'i chos gang lags pa bkas bshad du ci gnang zhes gsol nas tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don gyi tshul zab mo dag la rnal 'byor bsgoms pa'i chos gang lags pa bkas bshad du ci gnang zhes gsol nas tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
translated: Having said this, she spoke in verse:🔽I request of the Illuminator of the World,

original: bdag gis 'jig rten snang mdzad dang // rkang gnyis gtso bo mchog la ni //
analyzed: bdag gis 'jig rten snang mdzad dang // rkang gnyis gtso bo mchog la ni //
translated: The supreme foremost human,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag spyod //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag spyod //
translated: The bodhisattva's perfect conduct.

original: zhu na  thugs rjes gnang bar smon //🔽bcom ldan rigs kyi lha @96a *//
analyzed: zhu na  thugs rjes gnang bar smon // bcom ldan rigs kyi lha @96a *//
translated: If I ask, I pray that you will grant it out of compassion.🔽If the Blessed One, the celestial maiden of the family,

original: mo la // gal te the tshom yod gyur na //
analyzed: mo la // gal te the tshom yod gyur na //
translated: Has any doubts,

original: khyod kyis yid bzhin zhus shig dang // rnam phye bstan par bya zhes gsungs //
analyzed: khyod kyis yid bzhin zhus shig dang // rnam phye bstan par bya zhes gsungs //
translated: and I will explain it to you.”

original: de nas lha mos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bur //
analyzed: de nas lha mos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bur //
translated: Then the goddess said to the Lord:🔽“How should a bodhisattva

original: byang chub yang dag spyad spyod na //
analyzed: byang chub yang dag spyad spyod na //
translated: practice the conduct of enlightenment?

original: bdag dang gzhan la sman slad du //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la sman slad du //
translated: For the sake of benefiting oneself and others,

original: 'khor ba mya ngan 'das spangs 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor ba mya ngan 'das spangs 'gyur //
translated: how does one abandon saṃsāra and nirvāṇa?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi lha mo la bka' stsal pa //🔽chos kyi dbyings la brten te byang chub kyi chos spyad nas mnyam pa nyid kyi chos spyod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi lha mo la bka' stsal pa // chos kyi dbyings la brten te byang chub kyi chos spyad nas mnyam pa nyid kyi chos spyod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said to the goddess of the family:🔽“Relying on the realm of phenomena, one should practice the qualities of enlightenment and cultivate the conduct of sameness.

original: ji ltar chos kyi dbyings la brten te byang chub kyi chos la spyad nas mnyam pa nyid kyi spyod pa bsgom par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chos kyi dbyings la brten te byang chub kyi chos la spyad nas mnyam pa nyid kyi spyod pa bsgom par bya zhe na /
translated: How, relying on the realm of phenomena, should one practice the qualities of enlightenment and cultivate the conduct of sameness?”

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga po dag gis chos kyi dbyings ston par byas pas chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa de nyid phung po lnga yin yang phung po lnga'ang brjod du med la phung po lnga ma yin pa'ang brjod du med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga po dag gis chos kyi dbyings ston par byas pas chos kyi dbyings gang yin pa de nyid phung po lnga yin yang phung po lnga'ang brjod du med la phung po lnga ma yin pa'ang brjod du med do //
translated: In this way, the five aggregates are the realm of phenomena, and the realm of phenomena is the five aggregates. However, the five aggregates are inexpressible, and what is not the five aggregates is also inexpressible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings phung po lnga yin par gyur na ni chad pa'i lta bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings phung po lnga yin par gyur na ni chad pa'i lta bar 'gyur la /
translated: If the realm of phenomena were the five aggregates, that would be the view of annihilation.

original: gal te phung po lnga dang tha dad par gyur na ni rtag pa'i lta bar 'gyur bas mtshan nyid gnyis dang bral ba; mtha' gnyis la mngon par ma chags pa /
analyzed: gal te phung po lnga dang tha dad par gyur na ni rtag pa'i lta bar 'gyur bas mtshan nyid gnyis dang bral ba; mtha' gnyis la mngon par ma chags pa /
translated: If it were different from the five aggregates, that would be the view of permanence. Therefore, it is free from the two characteristics, is not attached to the two extremes,

original: bltar med pa /
analyzed: bltar med pa /
translated: is not visible,

original: blta bar bya ba las yang dag par 'das pa /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba las yang dag par 'das pa /
translated: and is beyond what can be seen.

original: ming med pa /
analyzed: ming med pa /
translated: It is without name,

original: mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi @96b dbyings bstan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa de ni chos kyi @96b dbyings bstan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and without signs. That is called the teaching of the realm of phenomena.

original: rigs kyi lha mo /
analyzed: rigs kyi lha mo /
translated: Noble goddess,

original: ji ltar phung po lnga po dag gis chos kyi dbyings ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar phung po lnga po dag gis chos kyi dbyings ston par byed ce na /
translated: how do the five aggregates teach the realm of phenomena?

original: 'di ltar phung po lnga dag ni rgyu dang / rkyen las skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po lnga dag ni rgyu dang / rkyen las skye ba ma yin no //
translated: In this way, the five aggregates are not produced from causes and conditions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te rgyu dang / rkyen las skyes pa zhig yin par gyur na skyes zin pa'i phyir skye'am /
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang / rkyen las skyes pa zhig yin par gyur na skyes zin pa'i phyir skye'am /
translated: If they were produced from causes and conditions, would they be produced because they have already arisen,

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir skye /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir skye /
translated: or would they be produced because they have not yet arisen?

original: gal te skyes zin pa zhig skye na ni rgyu dang / rkyen dgos pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te skyes zin pa zhig skye na ni rgyu dang / rkyen dgos pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If what has already arisen were to arise, what would be the point of causes and conditions?

original: gal te ma skyes pa zhig skye na ni nam yang skye ba dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma skyes pa zhig skye na ni nam yang skye ba dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If what has not yet arisen were to arise, then arising would never be observed.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma skyes pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin pa /
translated: Any non-arisen phenomenon does not exist,

original: ming med pa /
analyzed: ming med pa /
translated: does not have a name,

original: mtshan ma med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa /
translated: does not have a sign,

original: dgag par bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: is not something to be refuted,

original: dpe byar mi rung ba /
analyzed: dpe byar mi rung ba /
translated: is not a suitable example,

original: rgyu dang / rkyen gyis bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen gyis bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and is not something to be produced by causes and conditions.

original: rigs kyi lha mo /
analyzed: rigs kyi lha mo /
translated: Noble goddess,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / rnga'i sgra gang yin pa de ni shing la'ang brten /
analyzed: dper na / rnga'i sgra gang yin pa de ni shing la'ang brten /
translated: The sound of a drum depends on a tree,

original: ko ba dang / dbyug gu dang / lag pa la sogs pa la brten pa'i phyir sgra 'byung bar 'gyur yang 'di ltar rnga'i sgra gang yin pa de ni 'das pa'ang stong /
analyzed: ko ba dang / dbyug gu dang / lag pa la sogs pa la brten pa'i phyir sgra 'byung bar 'gyur yang 'di ltar rnga'i sgra gang yin pa de ni 'das pa'ang stong /
translated: The sound of the drum arises in dependence on the drum, the stick, the effort of the one who is beating the drum, the space inside the drum, and the space outside the drum.

original: ma 'ongs pa'ang stong /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'ang stong /
translated: The sound of the drum is empty of the past.🔽The sound of the drum is empty of the future.

original: da ltar byung ba'ang stong ngo //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'ang stong ngo //
translated: The sound of the drum is empty of the present.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rnga'i sgra gang yin pa de ni shing las kyang mi 'byung /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rnga'i sgra gang yin pa de ni shing las kyang mi 'byung /
translated: Why is that?🔽The sound of the drum does not arise from the wood.

original: ko ba las kyang mi 'byung /
analyzed: ko ba las kyang mi 'byung /
translated: The sound of the drum does not arise from the skin.

original: dbyug gu dang / lag pa las kyang mi 'byung /
analyzed: dbyug gu dang / lag pa las kyang mi 'byung /
translated: The sound of the drum does not arise from the stick.🔽The sound of the drum does not arise from the effort of the one who is beating the drum.🔽The sound of the drum does not arise from the space inside the drum.🔽The sound of the drum does not arise from the space outside the drum.

original: dus gsum las kyang mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: dus gsum las kyang mi 'byung bas /
translated: The sound of the drum does not arise from the three times.

original: de ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: It is unborn.

original: ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni 'gag par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: What is unborn does not cease.

original: 'gag @97a *// par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gang nas kyang mi 'ong ngo //
analyzed: 'gag @97a *// par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni gang nas kyang mi 'ong ngo //
translated: What does not cease does not come from anywhere.

original: gang nas kyang mi 'ong ba de ni gang du'ang 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang nas kyang mi 'ong ba de ni gang du'ang 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: What does not come from anywhere does not go anywhere.

original: gang du'ang 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rtag par yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang du'ang 'gro bar mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni rtag par yang ma yin /
translated: What does not go anywhere is not permanent.

original: chad par yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chad par yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it annihilated.

original: rtag par yang ma yin chad par yang ma yin pa de ni gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rtag par yang ma yin chad par yang ma yin pa de ni gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is neither permanent nor annihilated, nor is it identical,

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin pas so //
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin pas so //
translated: nor is it different.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gal te 'di gcig pa zhig yin na ni chos kyi dbyings dang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di gcig pa zhig yin na ni chos kyi dbyings dang tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were identical, it would not be different from the dharma-dhātu.

original: gal te de lta yin na ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyang yang dag pa'i bden pa mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag pa'i bden pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi /

analyzed: de lta bas na phung po lnga po dag ni yod pa ma yin /

original: thos par gyur na'ang 'di snyam du bdag gis ji ltar mthong ba'i glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa'i tshogs gang yin pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thos par gyur na'ang 'di snyam du bdag gis ji ltar mthong ba'i glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa'i tshogs gang yin pa de dag ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: And even if they do hear about it, they think, “The collection of elephants, horses, and so on that I see is not real.

original: sgyu ma'i dngos po mig slu bar byed pa tsam zhig yod par zad de mi bden pas glang po che la sogs pa dang / bang mdzod rnams yod do snyam du mi sems pas ming tsam zhig yod par zad kyi /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dngos po mig slu bar byed pa tsam zhig yod par zad de mi bden pas glang po che la sogs pa dang / bang mdzod rnams yod do snyam du mi sems pas ming tsam zhig yod par zad kyi /
translated: It is just an illusion that deceives the eye. It is not true. So I will not think that the elephants and so on and the treasury exist. They are just names.

original: yang dag pa ni ci'ang med do snyam du sems pas //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni ci'ang med do snyam du sems pas //
translated: Nothing at all is real.”

original: bdag nyid kyis ji ltar mthong zhing thos pas de dag la'ang yang dag pa nyid du 'dzin par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ji ltar mthong zhing thos pas de dag la'ang yang dag pa nyid du 'dzin par yang mi byed la /
translated: And because of what they have seen and heard, they do not even grasp at those things as real.

original: phyis dpyod cing sems pa'i tshe'ang yang dag pa ma yin par rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis dpyod cing sems pa'i tshe'ang yang dag pa ma yin par rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: And when they later investigate and reflect, they will understand that they are not real.

original: de bzhin du blo dang ldan pa dag gis kyang chos thams cad la yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas kun rdzob kyi rjes su ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar thos pa bzhin du dngos po ston cing brjod par byed kyi bden pa'i tshul yid la byed pa'i tshe ni de ltar ma yin te btags pa tsam du yang dag pa'i don rab tu ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du blo dang ldan pa dag gis kyang chos thams cad la yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas kun rdzob kyi rjes su ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar thos pa bzhin du dngos po ston cing brjod par byed kyi bden pa'i tshul yid la byed pa'i tshe ni de ltar ma yin te btags pa tsam du yang dag pa'i don rab tu ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the wise, by realizing that all phenomena are devoid of any real essence, teach and express things in accordance with the relative, as they are seen and heard. But when they are keeping in mind the way things truly are, it is not like that, for they teach the true meaning, which is merely an imputation.

original: @100b tshangs pa'i rgyal po /
analyzed: @100b tshangs pa'i rgyal po /
translated: Brahmā,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig ma thob pa dag ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid brjod du med pa mi shes pa'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo dag 'du byed dang / 'du byed ma yin pa'i chos mthong ngam /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig ma thob pa dag ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid brjod du med pa mi shes pa'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo dag 'du byed dang / 'du byed ma yin pa'i chos mthong ngam /
translated: ordinary beings, who have not acquired the supramundane ārya wisdom eye, do not know the inexpressible suchness of all phenomena. So, ordinary beings see and hear compounded and uncompounded phenomena.

original: thos par gyur na 'di ltar yang dag par yod pa yin no snyam du bsams nas mngon par zhen par bskyed nas don dam par chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid brjod du med pa yin par mi shes so //
analyzed: thos par gyur na 'di ltar yang dag par yod pa yin no snyam du bsams nas mngon par zhen par bskyed nas don dam par chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid brjod du med pa yin par mi shes so //
translated: If they hear it, they think, “It is like this: it really exists,” and they generate strong clinging. They do not understand that ultimately the reality of phenomena is inexpressible.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de dag ni 'du byed dang / 'du byed ma yin pa'i chos mthong ngam /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag gang yin pa de dag ni 'du byed dang / 'du byed ma yin pa'i chos mthong ngam /
translated: Those who are noble individuals, when they see or hear about conditioned and unconditioned phenomena,

original: thos par gyur na ci nus ci lcogs kyis yang dag par yod pa yin no snyam du mngon par zhen pa skyed par mi byed pas thams cad du yang dag pa'i 'du byed kyi chos dang / yang dag pa'i 'du byed ma yin pa'i chos med kyi mi bden pas bsams pa'i 'du byed dang /
analyzed: thos par gyur na ci nus ci lcogs kyis yang dag par yod pa yin no snyam du mngon par zhen pa skyed par mi byed pas thams cad du yang dag pa'i 'du byed kyi chos dang / yang dag pa'i 'du byed ma yin pa'i chos med kyi mi bden pas bsams pa'i 'du byed dang /
translated: do not generate clinging to the thought, “It really exists,” to the best of their ability and strength. Therefore, in all cases, there are no conditioned phenomena and no unconditioned phenomena. They are not real. They are thought of as conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'du byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dag gis ming tsam zhig yod pas yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ci'ang med do snyam du rig cing khong du chud par gyur kyang 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag kun rdzob kyi rjes su gzhan dag yang
analyzed: 'du byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de dag gis ming tsam zhig yod pas yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ci'ang med do snyam du rig cing khong du chud par gyur kyang 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag kun rdzob kyi rjes su gzhan dag yang
translated: They know and understand that, since they are mere names, they have no real essence at all.

original: dag pa'i don rtogs par bya bar 'dod pa'i phyir yang dag par ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dag pa'i don rtogs par bya bar 'dod pa'i phyir yang dag par ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, those noble beings teach correctly, in order to lead others to understand the ultimate truth.

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i rgyal po /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i rgyal po /
translated: Similarly, O King of Brahma,

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag kyang 'phags pa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas chos @101a *//
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag de dag kyang 'phags pa'i shes pa dang / mthong bas chos @101a *//
translated: those noble beings, with their noble knowledge and insight,🔽have realized the inexpressible suchness of phenomena.

original: rnams kyi de bzhin nyid brjod du med par rtogs par gyur kyang 'du byed dang / 'du byed ma yin pa'i chos 'di ltar gzhan dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyi ming dang / tha snyad rnam pa sna tshogs ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnams kyi de bzhin nyid brjod du med par rtogs par gyur kyang 'du byed dang / 'du byed ma yin pa'i chos 'di ltar gzhan dag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyi ming dang / tha snyad rnam pa sna tshogs ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, in order to lead others to understand, they teach various conventional names and expressions for conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de nas tshangs pa'i rgyal po chen pos byang chub sems dpa' yid bzhin rin chen 'od 'phro la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa'i rgyal po chen pos byang chub sems dpa' yid bzhin rin chen 'od 'phro la 'di skad ces smras so //

analyzed: sems can ji snyed cig gis yang dag pa'i chos zab mo 'di lta bu khong du chud par 'gyur /

original: smras pa / kye tshangs pa'i rgyal po /
analyzed: smras pa / kye tshangs pa'i rgyal po /

analyzed: sgyu ma'i skyes bu mang po'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos kyis yang dag pa'i chos zab mo 'di lta bu khong du chud par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tshangs pa'i rgyal pos smras pa /

original: smras pa / gang gis chos kyi dbyings yod pa'ang ma yin med pa'ang ma yin par shes pa'i sems can de dag gis don zab mo 'di shes par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshangs pa'i rgyal pos 'di skad ces gsol to //

translated: Brahma King,🔽if anyone hears and upholds this sutra of the excellent and sublime Golden Light, they will possess the power of great splendor.

translated: “Brahma­rāja, if any sons or daughters of the lineage were to write out this Golden Light Sūtra and read it or recite it with a one-pointed mind every half-month,

translated: By the power of hearing this supreme, sublime, nectar-like water of the true Dharma, your

translated: At that time, the king should bathe and purify himself, anoint his body with fragrant ointments, put on clean new clothes, adorn himself with garlands and jewelry, sit on a low seat, and not give rise to thoughts of superiority. He should

analyzed: shin tu mthun pa'i mdangs kyis tshig 'jam por smra bar bgyi'o //
